title: stable rustc panics on adding/removing `dyn` before a trait in a proc macro

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I was doing a small change to someone's crate, and encountered a crash. The weird thing is also that the crash is fixed by doing simple `cargo clean`, i.e. the problem was probably not in the code, but in the way `rustc` (or `cargo`) handles it between runs.

rustc 1.37.0/rustc 1.39.0-nightly (29a54035c 2019-08-19); linux debian buster x64

### Reproduce:

    git clone https://github.com/Defaultldentity/qmetaobject-rs -b rustc_crash
    cd qmetaobject-rs/qmetaobject
    cargo test # this works fine
    patch ../qmetaobject_impl/src/qobject_impl.rs minor_edit.patch # insignificant edit
    cargo test # this panics
    cargo clean
    cargo test # this works fine again
    git checkout .. # undo edit
    cargo test # this crashes again
    cargo clean && cargo test # works fine again, etc.

`minor_edit.patch` removes `dyn` before a trait name in a macro, which should just report a deprecation warning introduced in 1.37. The type should technically be the same, but this issue arises.

### Expected behavior:

`cargo clean` shouldn't influence compilation success, i.e. every `cargo test` should be successful.

### Crash log:

[compile.log](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/3522306/compile.log)
[compile_bt.log](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/3522305/compile_bt.log)
[compile_bt_full.log](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/files/3522304/compile_bt_full.log)
